meanings.definition: A small, low-growing plant with small leaves and white flowers.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with colorful flowers, but the delicate whorts stood out with their tiny white blooms.
meanings.sent2: I picked some whorts to add a touch of nature to my desk.
meanings.sent3: The whorts in the garden whispered secrets to the bees buzzing around.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden, with thoughts blooming like whorts in the spring.
meanings.sent5: The whorts added a magical charm to the otherwise ordinary garden.

meanings.definition: A small, insignificant amount or quantity.
meanings.sent1: He only had a few whorts of courage left to face his fears.
meanings.sent2: She sprinkled a few whorts of sugar on top of the cake.
meanings.sent3: The whorts of information he shared were barely enough to make sense of the situation.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean of knowledge, his words were mere whorts of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The whorts of kindness she showed made a big impact on those around her.

meanings.definition: To speak in a low, indistinct voice.
meanings.sent1: He would often whorts his answers during class, hoping not to be called on.
meanings.sent2: The shy boy would whorts his feelings to avoid attention.
meanings.sent3: She tried to whorts her excitement, but her eyes gave her away.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to whorts its secrets through the rustling leaves.
meanings.sent5: The old radio would whorts out static-filled music late into the night.
